title: 115_hr4885
content: The Act may be cited as the Fair Auto Insurance Ratemaking Reporting to Allow a Transparent Evaluation of Statistics Act of 2018 or the FAIR RATES Act of 2018. Data call. The FAIR RATES Act of 2018 authorizes the Director of the Federal Insurance Office to collect information from automobile insurers on a census tract level basis for private passenger automobile insurance. This includes details such as company name, experience year, census tract, and paid loss adjustment expenses. The FAIR RATES Act of 2018 allows the collection of detailed information from automobile insurers on a census tract level for private passenger automobile insurance. This includes data on paid and incurred loss adjustment expenses, count of claims recorded and closed, coverage types, and total premium written. The FAIR RATES Act of 2018 mandates the collection of detailed information from automobile insurers on a census tract level for private passenger automobile insurance, including total premium written, earned, exposures written, and earned by coverage type. The Director must determine the method and timing of information collection within six months of the Act's enactment. The Director must obtain detailed information from automobile insurers in a timely manner. If all required information cannot be collected as specified, insurers must submit it through appropriate intermediaries like the National Association of Insurance Commissioners. The Director must collect detailed information from automobile insurers within specific timeframes. If information is not received on time, insurers must submit it through designated channels like the National Association of Insurance Commissioners. SEC. 3. STUDY. The Director will conduct a study comparing private passenger automobile insurance costs and claims payments for areas with majority racial minority residents versus areas without. A report with analysis and findings must be submitted to Congress within 24 months of the enactment of this Act. The Director will publicly release all information collected for the study on private passenger automobile insurance, excluding personally identifiable information of insured individuals. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. This Act defines "covered automobile insurer" as an insurer with a surplus over $500,000,000 and annual premiums exceeding $500,000,000 for private passenger automobile insurance. The term "Director" refers to the Director of the Federal Insurance Office of the Department of the Treasury.
